title: Business Analyst - Reconciliation
description:
Nium, the Leader in Real-Time Global Payments 

 

Nium, the global leader in real-time, cross-border payments, was founded on the mission to deliver the global payments infrastructure of tomorrow, today. With the onset of the global economy, its payments infrastructure is shaping how banks, fintechs, and businesses everywhere collect, convert, and disburse funds instantly across borders.  

Its payout network supports 100 currencies and spans 220+ markets, 100 of which in real-time. Funds can be disbursed to accounts, wallets, and cards and collected locally in 35 markets. Nium's growing card issuance business is already available in 34 countries. Nium holds regulatory licenses and authorizations in more than 40 countries, enabling seamless onboarding, rapid integration, and compliance – independent of geography. The company is co-headquartered in San Francisco and Singapore. 




About the Team:

 

You will be part of the Financial Reconciliation Team focusing on Development of the internal reconciliation tool (SPOC) for all the products of NIUM. 




Key Responsibilities
In your role you would need to –
Have a strong understanding of bank reconciliation processes (Cross Border Remittances, Card Transactions, Wallet Transactions), implications, risks, and controls
Understand reconciliation & accounting requirements and articulate the same to the technology team
Writing and executing business requirement documents, functional specs, test cases
Working with technology team and business users for successful rollout of product features and processes
Work with Nium’s Product and Platform teams for integrating with new banks, payment gateways, card schemes/processors and other data sources required for reconciliation
Develop & maintain the product roadmap for Nium’s Global Reconciliation Platform o Define, track and maintain project delivery timelines across various teams – Product,
Platform, Tech, Operations & Financeo Prepare weekly/monthly/annually reports on priorities and development rollouts.o Make exceptions visible to the Operational Leadership team on a timely basis is very
key to the success in the role. 





Requirements
Good understanding of the nuances of a Reconciliation Platform and of accounting, reporting & internal controls
5+ years of experience with existing/off-the-shelf reconciliation platforms e.g., Intellimatch, ReconArt, etc.
Strong hands-on knowledge experience in Payments or Cards or Wallets or all in a multicurrency environment
Good understanding of payment formats like SWIFT/ACH, currencies, payment gateways, operational risk around payments.
Worked with Operations and Finance teams to meet their requirements within defined timelines.
Should have actively worked on large and mid-sized technology projects
Should have in-depth understanding of SDLC
Self-driven and a go getter who is comfortable in dealing with open ended problems.
Is solution oriented and can come up with solution options for problem statements.
